metadata.title: CVE-2013-1009 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
WebKit, as used in Apple Safari before 6.0.5, allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption andapplication crash) via a crafted web site, a different vulnerability thanCVE-2013-1023.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1009` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-1.0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-1.0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
